review: I have bipolar II & adhd. Regulating my emotions and organizing my thoughts can be extremely difficult at times. This app literally feels like a miracle. 2 days into my 7 day free trial of the membership, I was sold. I can track my moods and sleep, check off daily goals (and set reminders to do them!), see trends over time and see how they correlate with other variables, record thought distortions and challenge them, ground myself back from a panic attack, practice daily gratitude, and more. All that for $60 a year, that‚Äôs not bad at all. This app gives me the practical, tangible steps to take to become healthier and gives me the structure and encouragement I need to get there. Not to mention I had an issue with a function of the app and Ron, the CEO I think, emailed with me morning noon and night over the weekend to get it resolved. I‚Äôve never had that kind of customer service, seriously. Highly highly recommend this app. & it‚Äôs 1000% worth the paid subscription. Hey Ron, I only have like 150 followers on social media but can I advertise for you? üòÇ Not hard when you believe in the product ü§ô
title: Amazing app, amazing customer service
developerResponse: {'id': 18858253, 'body': "Thank you so much for the awesome review! We're genuinely grateful when users share their stories about how Moodfit is helpful to them. Thank you!", 'modified': '2020-11-02T19:33:50Z'}

review: I love this app very much. I really like all the tools it has to improve mood. The primary reason why I am giving this four stars instead of five stars Hass to do with the accessibility with voiceover. Voiceover is an accessibility service that changes how the device works to help blind and visually impaired people like me use the touchscreen. In order for voiceover to work well, the app and the interface Hass to be programmed right. Don't get me wrong, because I do think this is one of the most accessible apps for mood out there, but it is lacking a couple of things with voiceover accessibility. For example, when I try to customize the days for a reminder, voiceover does not give me any indication of which days are checked off. For the days that are checked off for the reminders, why not have voiceover say something like M selected or M checked? That would give blind and visually impaired users an indication that Monday is checked off. Otherwise, everything else about this app is great. If it wasn't for the voiceover accessibility problem, then I would give this five stars.
title: Love this app but, ‚Ä¶
developerResponse: {'id': 20562233, 'body': "Thank you for taking the time to provide this feedback. It's very helpful and something we want to incorporate into future versions. Gratefully yours!", 'modified': '2021-01-21T20:13:24Z'}

review: The app is pretty awesome to be honest. I never thought I‚Äôd be keeping track of my moods through an app but here I am‚Ä¶. And it‚Äôs definitely helped me with keeping track of my moods and other daily goals I set. The CBT part of the app is probably my favorite though. Anytime I have distorted thinking, I‚Äôll go in the app and write out why I was feeling the way I was, or at least try to figure out why I was feeling like I was and try to work through it so I can try to rewire the way my brain acts I‚Äôm certain situations. I have adhd, bi-polar disorder as well as a couple other disorders and this app has definitely helped in keeping me somewhat sane‚Ä¶. Try it out!
title: App has helped me out a lot üí™

review:
I truly love this app. I've been using it since around September 2020, and I am starting to schedule it back into my routine again. It helps me to develop a schedule around understanding my emotions and anchoring me during rough parts of the day. 

The only thing that I wish was better was how long the loading time is when I update an activity. Navigating the app is a difficult because the page-loading-time is slow, even when connected to stable WiFi. This is something that needs to be improved upon, especially when you have a subscription. However, it is a wonderful resource despite app navigation.

review: This app is amazing. I have adhd and anxiety and I‚Äôve been struggling to track my mood/focus and other things daily to see how It changes throughout time. This app allows me to track my therapy sessions, medication, sleep, time spent on mindfulness, exercise, etc. which really helps me visualize the circumstances surrounding my feelings and mood that day. I‚Äôve used a lot of apps similar to this but they‚Äôve all been separate apps. This app is everything I need built into one. Highly recommend !

review: I like the daily messages. They can help you think differently about your feelings and give you encouragement at the same time. I am still new to using this and will be exploring more of the options available. Thanks for making it easy to use!

It does a lot more than track mood, but food, exercise, gratitude, etc. The designers did a great job.
